intro: Sphaerine angustipetala, commonly known as the narrow-petalled sphaerine, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a hairy texture, and it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. It is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments within woodlands and grasslands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
